fields.description: Computes a set of features for the contained string, including phonemes, syllables, stresses, etc. To access any of these, use myRistring.get(name)
Returns the character at the specified 'index'

parameters.desc: index of the character (accepts negative offsets, which count backward from lhe end)

fields.description: Concatenates the text from another RiString at the end of this one
Tests if this string ends with the specified suffix

returns.desc: true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of the character sequence represented by this object; false otherwise

fields.description:
Compares this RiString to the specified object.
The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a String or RiString object that represents the same sequence of characters as this object.

parameters.desc: String or RiString object to compare this RiString against

returns.desc: true if the RiString are equal; false otherwise.

fields.description: Compares this RiString to another RiString or a String, ignoring case considerations

parameters.desc: String or RiString object to compare this RiString against

returns.desc: true if the argument is not null and the Strings are equal, ignoring case; false otherwise

fields.description: Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the 'searchstring'

parameters.desc: (Optional) The start position in the string to start the search. If omitted, the search starts from position 0

returns.desc: the first index of the matching pattern or -1 if not found

fields.description: Inserts 'newWord' at 'wordIdx' and shifts each subsequent word accordingly.

parameters.desc: the position at which it insert the word

fields.description: Returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character

parameters.desc: (Optional) The start position in the string to start the search. If omitted, the search starts from position 0

returns.desc: the last index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found

fields.description: Returns the length of this string
Searches for a match between a substring (or regular expression) and the contained string, and _returns the matches

returns.desc: strings matches or empty array if none are found

fields.description: Returns an array of part-of-speech tags, one per word, using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.getPosTags()

returns.desc: strings of pos, one per word

fields.description: Returns the part-of-speech tag for the word at 'index', using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.getPosTags()
Removes the character at the specified index

Replaces the character at 'idx' with 'replaceWith'.
If the specified 'idx' is less than zero, or beyond the length of the current text, there will be no effect
Replaces the first instance of 'regex' with 'replaceWith'
Replaces the last instance of 'regex' with 'replaceWith'
Replaces each substring of this string that matches the given regular expression with the given replacement.
Replaces the word at 'wordIdx' with 'newWord'
Extracts a part of a string from this RiString

parameters.desc: The index where to begin the extraction. First character is at index 0
(Optional) Where to end the extraction. If omitted, slice() selects all characters from the begin position to the end of the string

fields.description: Split a RiString into an array of RiStrings, one for each element after the split, and returns the new array.
Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix

returns.desc:
true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by this string; false otherwise.
Note also that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this RiString object as determined by the equals() method.

fields.description: Extracts the characters from a string, between two specified indices, and sets the current text to be that string.

parameters.desc: The index where to start the extraction. First character is at index 0
(optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the rest of the string

fields.description: Extracts the characters from this objects contained string, beginning at 'start' and continuing through the specified number of characters, and sets the current text to be that string. (from Javascript String)

parameters.desc: The index where to start the extraction. First character is at index 0
(optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the rest of the string

fields.description: Gets/sets the text contained by this object

returns.desc: the contained text (for sets) or this RiString (for gets)

fields.description: Converts this object to an array of RiString objects, one per character

returns.desc: RiStrings with each letter as its own RiString element

fields.description: Converts all of the characters in this RiString to lower case
Converts all of the characters in this RiString to upper case
Removes leading and trailing whitespace from the RiString
Returns the word at 'index', according to RiTa.tokenize()
Returns the number of words in the object, according to RiTa.tokenize().
Returns the array of words in the object, via a call to RiTa.tokenize()
